and	well-chosen	details;	use	
appropriate	eye	contact,	
adequate	volume,	and	clear	
pronunciation.

538C192C45E44067A89C65CE723F761D.description:
Know	contexts	that	call	
for	formal	(e.g.,	presenting	
ideas)	versus	informal	(e.g.,	
small-group	discussion)	
English;	use	formal	English	
when	appropriate.

493B4AFC95C84377B521B207BCCA3380.description:
Use multimedia	
components	(e.g.,	graphics,	
sound)	and	visual	displays	in	
presentations when	
appropriate	to	enhance	the	
development	of	main	ideas	or	
themes.

62778A6692E941D3BD619B10BEB82BAC.description:
Report	on	a	topic	or	
text	or	present	an	opinion,	
sequencing	ideas	logically	and	
using	appropriate	facts	and	
relevant,	descriptive	details	to	
support	main	ideas	or	themes;	
speak	clearly	at	an	
understandable	pace.

517891B560294EC6BA844A16DBDFBB1E.description:
Speak	in	complete	
sentences	when	appropriate	to	
task	and	situation	in	order	to	
provide	requested	detail	or	
clarification.

1C772ACE62234A7CB0DB7D25561B7D9A.description:
Create	engaging	audio	
recordings	of	stories	or	poems	
that	demonstrate	fluent	
reading;	add	visual	displays	
when	appropriate	to	enhance	
certain	facts	or	details.

DCBBEE3588354BEB84D8D64A7CB9457C.description:
Report	on	a	topic	or	
text,	tell	a	story,	or	recount	an	
experience	with	appropriate	
facts	and	relevant,	descriptive	
details,	speaking	clearly at	an	
understandable	pace.

EAC06A25CAA1417AA8F13579457186E2.description:
Speak	audibly	and	
express	thoughts,	feelings,	and	
ideas	clearly.	Produce	
complete	sentences	
appropriate	to	task	and	
situation.

7AC25B2C5B5D44C8B247B43E35E1F727.description:
Add	drawings	or	other	
visual	displays	to	descriptions	
when	appropriate	to	clarify	
ideas,	thoughts,	and	feelings.

832D3FDFD137485D92DA6B01AD814B5D.description:
Describe	people,	places,	
things,	and	events	with	
relevant	details,	expressing	
ideas	and	feelings	clearly.

306F0556A7514812BE437A057BC6304E.description:
Presentation	of	Knowledge	and	Ideas:	The	student	will	develop	and	apply	skills	to	demonstrate	presentation	of	knowledge	and	
ideas of	oral	and	aural	information.

49A9C7741BD7426BB0102C2F5D481C92.description: Delineate a speaker's argument and specific claims, evaluating the validity of the reasoning and sufficiency of the evidence.

EAB294E2F9CE4CFAB8408ED8C64E6CE5.description: Analyze the main ideas and supporting details to determine the purpose of information in graphical, oral, visual, or multimodal formats; evaluate the motives (e.g., social, commercial, political) behind its presentation.

F4C7ED4331504A5CB9031A37660E9B33.description: Acknowledge new information expressed by others, and, when warranted, qualify or justify their own views in light of the evidence presented.

BE9272C49CFD4EEAB1B268457D34BA8E.description: Pose questions that connect the ideas of several speakers and elicit elaboration.  Respond to others' questions and comments with relevant evidence, observations, and ideas.

58E6EAE265B34D19BFB178F63E19D46F.description: Work with peers to set rules for discussions.

04102770775E4D5CA57A2C900E4E886D.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or researched material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.

B9C3A724B3E0491EAE9A8B940459B1F7.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one and in groups) building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

2C22A36F859440F7B27056AF924B0463.description: Summarize the points a speaker makes and explain how each claim is supported by reasons and evidence.

F177FD463C2A4A2EAF1D04E7166BE31B.description: Summarize written texts read aloud or information presented graphically, orally, visually, or multimodally.

A3031C79C7EC4D3CB794CBE8CF1FD8BE.description: Review the key ideas expressed and draw conclusions in light of information and knowledge gained from the discussions.

3B6EA33B216F4B1FAE8C147F821EB012.description: Pose and respond to specific questions by making comments that contribute to the discussion and elaborate on the remarks of others.

BC3418B3D08E440E83E70A79152C91AB.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.

ABB01C5469F54C19AA1972F75FE13C5E.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.

AA59BF1F36B04B2A91FC2E4F5A6F316F.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one and in groups), building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

BD1F59ED146D4EB6923856F5D8A87211.description: Ask and answer questions about what a speaker says to clarify comprehension, gather additional information, or deepen understanding.  Offer appropriate elaboration and detail about what a speaker says.

5ACD29D02ACA401281588F85FE7D5776.description: Identify the main ideas and supporting details of written texts read aloud or information presented graphically, orally, visually, or multimodally.

FC1388070B53422C8A139A0E6C38E55A.description: Explain their own ideas and understanding in light of the discussion.

7FFCCC367FFD4600A79D8AB4C4F15A1D.description: Ask questions to check understanding of information presented, stay on topic, and link their comments to the remarks of others.

AC5158BB8C694E74B0B48EE00F0DA014.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., gaining the floor in respectful ways, listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

9B3BFC9843724D30ADE41DDCCCF13121.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one and in groups) building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

298A150412B24E44A0A39D086F6415DD.description: Ask and answer questions about what a speaker says in order to seek help, gather additional information or clarify something that is not understood.

8DBA2FEEAC1C4469AECDBB68686A47E2.description: Demonstrate understanding of written texts presented orally by asking and answering questions about key details and restating key elements.

4201AE1336254BC1ADDA1FC4566BE92B.description: Ask questions to clear up any confusion about the topics and texts under discussion.

D84606AD01414D2A973E360AC714BC85.description: Build on others' talk in conversations by responding to the comments of others through multiple exchanges.

D29CEA7327454590A4316F7C85BE6FC7.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

7EE38732549A45498B71D0E58EAB834B.description: Participate in collaborative conversations in small and larger groups.

DF7BD2D78FC1444BBAC2A15E7CD50385.description: Comprehension and Collaboration:  The student will develop and apply skills to demonstrate comprehension and collaboration of oral and aural information.

646EAC457CBA4972893CDA7536C87A5E.description: Speaking and Listening Content Standards with Benchmarks

1C32CEC7933341C2860CBFE7BB57073A.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research by applying reading standards to literature and literary nonfiction.

86D76F6BAD964CDEB96B5045E935ED45.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

9093EC8078DB40FA9A0E4313374D8A4F.description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and generating additional related, focused questions for further research and investigation.

9F1DD40A352C4391BB5C776A63B4E720.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and present the relationships between information and ideas efficiently as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

48E9E0FC0CA245B6B424ABCC4660651A.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

16D0C9A225354360A1851359AC085856.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and audience have bee addressed.

CD348A20C8B94217BF6FDF1BD9D87B07.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.  The argument should: a) Introduce claim(s), acknowledge alternate or opposing claims, and organize the reasons and evidence logically; b) Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant evidence, using accurate, credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text; c) Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s), reasons, and evidence; d) Establish and maintain a formal style; and e) Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented

E2D4E9C99A774E5E94A65A9972F679EF.description: Write informative and explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.  The texts should: a) Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison / contrast, and cause / effect, include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aid comprehension;  b) Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples; c) Use appropriate transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts; d) Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic. e) Establish and maintain style; and concluding statement or section that follow from and supports the information or explanation presented.

58EC6E79B1644BF89138891D00106CAF.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

F24BC63E26A34EB9AEAA789D78A9D054.description: Draw evidence from literary or information texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.  The evidence should a) Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or a drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., how the characters interacted); b) Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and evidence support which points;

7B856081F1534F17967602BC287C423F.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

03D7F12F2590413B94823AEF3227865F.description: Conduct short research projects that use several sources to build knowledge through investigation or different aspects of a topic.

E0091B0271884B4495A2FFC03110E917.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of one page in a single sitting.

8043EE25B3B14F568BED3EC0C8610ED5.description: Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and digital sources; summarize or paraphrase information in notes and finished work, ad provide a list of sources.

A6CE9307539445FA891CA086694B2EB9.description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information.  The pieces should: a) Introduce a topic or text, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure in which related ideas are grouped to support the writer's purpose; b) Provide logical reasons that are supported by facts / details; c) Link opinion and reasons using words, clauses, and phrases (e.g., for instance, in order to, in addition, consequently, specifically); and d) Provide a concluding statement or section related to the opinion presented.

5F6E878E42E9405CA5A258789EF68DBD.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear even sequences.  The narratives should: a) Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing a narrator and / or characters and organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally; b) Use dialogue and description to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to situations; c) Use a variety of transitional words and phrases to manage the sequence of events; d) Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely; and e) Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

8292269CE53F473FBBF4A2ABF996904E.description: Write informative and explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clear.  The text should: a) Introduce the topic clearly, group related information in paragraphs and sections, and include formatting, illustrations and multimedia when useful to aid comprehension;  b) Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples; c) Link ideas within categories of information using words and phrases (e.g., another, for example, also, because) and use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic; and d) Provide a concluding statement or section related to the information / explanation presented.

E02E530E6D524C9EA48298CB1C9891BB.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing.

99FF4AF3271E49FA85F5925D3EF720FF.description: Produce writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task and purpose.

2784AF53F3E14FE58629003AC2D5DEE3.description: Conduct short research projects that build knowledge about a topic.

1C7841B7A6D7412DB2DC3D48D3E7C732.description: Use technology to produce and publish writing as well as interact and collaborate with others.

C4979F9EB6F14E47A56A8E0844BD1645.description: Gather information from print and digital resources; take brief notes on sources and sort evidence into provided categories.

14CDCAC15F8A4A91A8E32B911FC09E6E.description: Write opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic or book they are writing about, state an opinion, supply reasons that support the opinion, use linking words (e.g., because, and, also) to connect opinion and reasons and provide a concluding statement for section.

5618D4495733424998FE0F9A9FF136FF.description: Write narratives in which they recount a well-elaborated event or short sequence of events, include details to describe actions, thoughts, and feelings, use temporal words to signal event order, and provide a sense of closure.

57A7063126E0456F99302880FB7C9390.description: Write informative or explanatory text in which they introduce a topic, use facts and definitions to develop points, use linking words and phrases to connect ideas with categories of information, and provide a concluding statement or section.

59E8FC7FC1534006B39FB91E32D06034.description: Use a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

33D51D709477468EAB7DA82138FD98C0.description: Recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

41BC59A53AAB4D18A840609B336FAA1A.description: Focus on a topic, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

789F0792225F42E2BDF941C9732D6A96.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate an event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

49869D50870E4B0E9428741653DFFFE2.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative or explanatory texts in which they name a topic, provide some facts, and provide some sense of closure.

B9B7C8EB65044B5E83250829D31B24A3.description: Composition:  The student will develop and apply the writing process to communicate in writing for a variety of purposes.

D4BA89615CBA48708403DB7C32472BD4.description: Establish and maintain tense in a writing piece.

8702FC0046E34A688F8FA87F36C94DD4.description: Demonstrate mastery of past and present tense.

7E114DF3A0464D4AA692620FFF4CD6E1.description: Identify how parts of speech work in a particular sentence, i.e., noun used as an object instead of a subject.

E690EB551A7B4CC9976BF3C76EE83B0F.description: Identify all parts of speech, including nouns, verbs, adjectives, adverbs, conjunctions, prepositions, interjections, and verbals (verbs used as nouns, adjectives, or adverbs such as infinitives, participles, and gerunds).

980D94204EC941D095488933A7DF84CF.description: Correctly use the nominative and objective cases of pronouns, i.e., she / her.

75C1E99115C84A22B1B33206EA74C5EA.description: Distinguish present tense, past tense, and future tense of common verbs.

C7E74D6E7AB948A19231D5971F983EC9.description: Write the appropriate forms of common regular and irregular verbs, past, present, and past participle.

6FA1FD38B1234A54B2527A9FC500C8D1.description: Identify nouns, verbs, pronouns, adjectives, adverbs, conjunctions, prepositions, and interjections.

53A532E7DD8C4FFCB3FBF4EEBDF6578B.description: Make pronouns and antecedents agree in number and gender.

79DADEF1E1CA4B0D91CA1122964B384E.description: Identify the appropriate forms of common regular and irregular verbs.

D8E513B8F1C04C98B63359773AF2AD4A.description: Distinguish between correct use of verbs in affirmative and negative forms in simple sentences.

93729CCEDC1D4C2A9F30D2A3B2C86BC5.description: Correctly identify the singular and plural forms of nouns.

37E35B987BCA486AB11102D132660715.description: Compose simple sentences in both present and past tense.

383B43CF461A42E1B7AD47A487B33CA9.description: Distinguish between past and present tense in sentences.

E4505E6372D34360882661A302D4A554.description: Identify and distinguish between nouns, pronouns, and verbs in simple sentences.

445BFB90D9BE4370A6E3C7989EF943C2.description: Parts of Speech, Verb Tense, and Usage:  The student will apply knowledge of parts of speech, verb tense, and usage to complete a variety of writing tasks.

9D04B1863BE74259AA1794B1704C9F42.description: Sustain a consistent point of view throughout a multiple paragraph text.

348041AB4BA24E33AE4F2A76ABFFB03B.description: Develop appropriate tense use throughout a multiple paragraph text.

F999BD8DE81649B0A4F1D75C24458CAB.description: Write paragraphs with clear connections and transitions between sentences.

D77BE08F37E941B6A799039892C106CF.description: Write paragraphs with stated or implied topic sentences.

D6A31E14252942888D242F706ED8F045.description: Recognize how parts of a sentence are used to manipulate meaning in sentences (independent clauses, introductory clauses, and phrases, etc.).

EEA0BA26B81C4DF6A3CAB975D6B6330E.description: Identify the understood subject of a command.

39A70DD19D17441E96F38AD33AF0136E.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative language such as metaphors and similes.

A9372023BCD24196AD3A198578971BBC.description: Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or drama drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., how characters interact). 39B9E480C0FB4D089B700BA4EC3F6061.description: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text, including how characters in a story or drama respond to challenges or how the speaker in a poem reflects upon a topic; summarize the text, including main ideas.

B02ED748A450440B9E85F85EF9ECF1E1.description: Read and comprehend informational texts (historical, scientific) and literature (stories, dramas), for the current level, independently and proficiently.

1D78CF0269A74315B13F990C7674EA69.description: Compare and contrast the themes, settings, and plots of of stories written by the same author about the same or similar characters (e.g., in books from a series) or compare and contrast the most important points and key details presented in two texts on the same topic.

4F6DD5763B5F4780A4A4114FB2BFD8CB.description: Recount stories, including fables, folktales, and myths from diverse cultures; determine the central message, lesson, or moral and explain how it is conveyed through key details in the text.

80A44BB8FF5F4D719218606775F8D8E2.description: Identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

8C43C596227441DFA861EB05A2D45B7C.description: Increase vocabulary of tier 2 words including academic terms and phrases.

B69B65C3E38743C191170089401131A8.description: Identify and interpret basic figurative language and idioms used in everyday life and in text.

6787CC2F4E924C4294716D5AC4645831.description: Use a dictionary to locate the meaning of words used in a statement and a thesaurus to find words with the same meaning.

5326518FA14F4ECAAAB478F4DB91D30D.description: Recognize and comprehend the meaning of moderately complex occupational, technical, and content-specific vocabulary using word, sentence, and paragraph clues to determine meaning.

36491CB0D2E74B8FBB9B7D6032BD55C4.description: Use prefixes, suffixes, root words, antonyms, and synonyms to determine meaning of unfamiliar words.

159FB638AE84430F80E40C73092A8558.description: Use structural analysis (familiar word parts:  base words, prefixes, and suffixes) and / or context clues to determine the meaning of an unknown word.

F12318DBC4C54C409E09F920C8577CEE.description: Recognize synonyms, antonyms, homonyms, and homophones for identified vocabulary words presented in isolation or within a group of words.

EDD9809B99D44FEC8C37CF36FDBD8B16.description: Read common numbers, symbols and abbreviations (e.g., clock time, prices, sizes, dollar sign) in isolated words and phrases in familiar contexts.

C6C98725EBAB483E875BD231D61F41A0.description: Identify common functional and survival signs and labels with one word or symbol.

D3B8981E56BB4942AB9A206E6341B066.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (ex. the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

51D1761E2A6A44348D5B55F8A00040A1.description: Demonstrate ability to read personal information (name, address, zip code, phone number, age).

8CA6FA836278480DB7D970CC613EF7B6.description: Vocabulary:  The student will develop and demonstrate knowledge of vocabulary skills that include analyzing word structure, determining the meaning or words from context, sorting words into groups by meaning and relationships among words, and applying vocabulary skills in order to understand a wide and varied vocabulary that enhances comprehension of literary, functional, and informational text.

19DCCB233AE24510976C2BBED7350F86.description: Use decoding strategies (letter-sound correspondences, syllabication patterns, and morphology) to read accurately unfamiliar multisyllabic words in context and out of context.

92E03750EF3E4BC784280EA9523F757C.description: Identify and know the meaning of the most common root words, prefixes, and suffixes and use them to decode multi-syllable words.

FD0F4EFA83274C29A89A7D676A985168.description: Identify and use contractions and be able to match them to the two words being replaced (e.g., I'm for I am).

5D5BF149EE684256922513F7D91963CD.description: Identify words with inflectional endings (e.g., s, es, ed, ing, er, est).

4202D829E57149CFB740A91D7E62F183.description: Identify and use silent consonants (e.g., kn, gh).

5C462701BB5B49919295781A4AE84442.description: Identify the shwa sound (e.g., away) and use to decode simple words.

BE54189197044074B089B620B65B3E97.description: Identify dipthongs (e.g., ou, aw, sy) and use to decode one-syllable words.

0E1AD5DFA2F1482BB4FF3FD5F2D7A7E4.description: Segment spoken one-syllable words into their complete sequence of individual sounds (phonemes) and then substitute individual sounds to make new words.

77AEB14782B84D10BE26611D68434D69.description: Recognize and discriminate among lowercase and uppercase letters and their corresponding sounds.  Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

8DEA2C88942D424B9DF268D3C4DF2479.description: Recognize the concepts of print (left to right, top to bottom, front to back, return sweep). Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.  Recognize the distinguishing features of a sentence (e.g., first word, capitalization, ending punctuation).

290C8A0E4CDC4175BC1AB55B558051AF.description: Print Concepts / Phonemic Awareness / Word Analysis:  The student will develop and demonstrate knowledge of print concepts and phonemic awareness, word analysis, and decoding strategies to pronounce and derive meaning of words.
